Title: Outcomes and Evaluations Clinical Manager
Qualifications: Master’s degree experience in related clinical field (e.g., psychology, sociology, public health, social work, etc) required.
Education: Master’s degree experience in related clinical field (e.g., psychology, sociology, public health, social work, etc) required.
Requirement: Master’s degree experience in related clinical field (e.g., psychology, sociology, public health, social work, etc) required.
FullDescriptions:
Under supervision of the O&E Director, the O&E Clinical Manager is responsible for supervising the O&E Data Analyst(s), Research Specialist(s), and Research Assistant II’s to ensure effective database management and reporting (electronic and paper). In addition, this position will collaborate with programs to evaluate, develop, and implement outcomes based on agency, program, and county requirements. This resource will provide oversight to the creation of logic models and evaluate programs per agency and contractual requirements. This resource will also work closely with Clinical Programs and the Quality Assurance department. In addition, this resource will support the O&E Director to build relationships and collaborate with external entities (e.g., Universities) for data sharing, research projects, conferences, and publications.


Essential Duties

Supervision and training

1. Supervise staff that support analysis and reporting functions of the department to ensure accuracy of data from a variety of data sources (e.g., Electronic Health Record, HR, Training, etc);

2. Supervise Research Specialist to conduct analysis and evaluation, write annual reports, and develop new program logic models;

3. Develop, maintain and train staff on the Reports Procedure Manual and Training curriculum.

Database Management and Statistical Analysis

1. Oversee documentation of business processes and requirements;

2. Exhibit high level of analytical thinking and database management;

3. Knowledge of and application of a wide range of statistical analysis;

4. Coordinate with IT on data extracts and data quality.

Data Visualization and Reporting

1. Oversee the delivery of data in an actionable and appealing way to users;

2. Advise, consult, develop, and provide technical support and training to staff in visualization of data;

3. Collaborate with clinical programs and external entities to meet data visualization and reporting needs;

4. Make large and/or complex data sets more accessible, understandable, and usable;

5. Develop training curriculum and train staff on report processes;

6. Lead ad-hoc report requests, support routine agency-wide and regional reports, and oversee analysis required for RFPs

7. Oversee quality of internal/external reports

8. Partner with clinical programs and other departments to interpret results, monitor progress and develop CQI plans

Collaboration

1. Collaborate with the O&E Administrative Manager

2. Liaison with internal departments on county-required reporting and RFP-responses

3. Collaborate with Learning and Development, IT, Human Resources, and Quality Assurance teams on implementing and sustaining O&E related Continuous Quality Improvement projects


Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

All employees are responsible for keeping job requirements up to date. This can include but are not limited to certifications, licensure, and maintaining a clear criminal record.


Education Requirements
Master’s degree experience in related clinical field (e.g., psychology, sociology, public health, social work, etc) required.


Experience Requirements
Minimum of 2 years of program evaluation and 2 years’ experience with research group; or 4 years program evaluation required.
Experience communicating results in publications and/or professional conferences required.
Experience with data visualization (Tableau) preferred.


Other Specific Requirements
Must pass Department of Justice (DOJ), Federal Bureau of Investigations (FBI), and Child Abuse Index Check (CAIC) background clearance.
Valid California Driver's license with two years of experience driving and clean driving record may be required.


Work Environment/Conditions

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be required to use hands to handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; and taste or smell. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

In addition this position requires sitting, standing, walking, climbing, and kneeling.


Employee Statement of Understanding

I have read and understand the job description for my position. I am able to perform all of the essential functions of this position.

I agree to successfully complete all required training indicated for this position. I agree to keep all of my required certifications and licenses current and up to date and provide proper documentation of the same to the Human Resources Department. I agree to comply with all Agency policies and procedures. I agree to comply with the agency compliance plan and all laws, rules, regulations and standards of conduct relating to my position. As an employee, I understand my duty to report any suspected violations of the law or the standards of conduct to my immediate supervisor. As an employee, I will strive to uphold the mission and vision of the organization. All employees are required to adhere to the values in all their interactions with youth and families and fellow employees.

Title: Core Data - Data Analyst/ Data Architect
FullDescriptions:
Summary
Posted: Mar 21, 2019
Role Number: 200046821
At Apple, new ideas become great products, services, and customer experiences. Apple is seeking a Core Data - data analyst/ data architect to join the Apple Media Products Analytics and Data Products group. AMP (home to Apple Music, App Store, iTunes and more) has some of the most compelling data in the world. We seek a hardworking data analyst with experience in building pipelines, who is motivated by meaningful problems and well versed with big data environment. This is a unique opportunity to join a focused team and work collaboratively with other groups to make a significant impact.
Key Qualifications
You have 4+ years crafting and building data pipelines
At least 8+ years of SQL experience with the ability to write ad-hoc and complex queries to perform data analysis
You possess strong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Relevant and substantial work experience with business requirements definition and management (end to end), structured analysis, process design, use case documentation, UML process and use case definition
At least 2+ years of Spark SQL, Linux, Hadoop experience
2+ years of experience in data modeling (conceptual, logical models)
You have solid grasp of advanced data warehouse concepts (Factless Fact tables, Temporal \ BI-Temporal models, etc.)
Experience with both Waterfall and Agile development methodologies
You have ability to identify where focus is needed and bring clarity to business objectives, requirements and priorities
You have strong facilitation and communication skills (both verbal and written). Capable of collaborating effectively across a variety of Engineering and Data analyst groups
Overall technical understanding of data warehousing, business intelligence, web and other multi-tiered, distributed applications/systems.
Description
As a member of the Core Data team, you will have significant responsibility and influence in shaping the future of core data landscape. This role is inherently cross-functional and the ideal candidate will work across disciplines. We are looking for someone with a love for data and ability to iterate quickly through capturing data needs from the partners, analyzing source data and data needs, creating data models and working in close collaboration with engineering, QA, analysts to deliver core datasets that support data integration, analytics and reporting. Successful candidates will have strong analytical skills and communication, as well as, a belief that data driven processes lead to great products.
Key Responsibilities:
Capture and manage business data needs from various stakeholders
Develop data models (conceptual, logical) in support of integrated analytics, business reporting and data exchange
Perform data profiling on source system data to ensure that source system data can be integrated and represented properly in our models
Assist downstream consumers and report developers, analysts with best usage of the models
Partner with Engineering and EPMs to develop core datasets as per the specification (includes data model definitions)
Provide assistance and guidance during the QA phase to quickly confirm the validity of potential issues and to determine the root cause and best resolution of verified issues
Perform UAT to confirm core datasets satisfy the business needs Partner with EPMs to review projects status, risks and enable mitigation plans
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Information Systems.

FullDescriptions:
Overview
We are looking for A players to help transform our People Analytics and Technology team to become a world-class organization. If you are a passionate, innovative, system thinker, influential professional that want to use your data chops to make BIG Impact on both people and business, that's the role for you!

As member of our team, you would have a unique opportunity to design and implement a strong data and analytics foundation to help us achieve our mission of ‘Maximizing the Potential of our Employees’ and accelerate Intuit's business growth.
Responsibilities
Our Staff Data Analysts have the opportunity to partner with People & Places and Business Leaders to determine their workforce strategy and roadmap. They lead analytics efforts to measure business outcomes, customer benefit, and customer experiences and produce valuable insights based on the data. Analysts communicate the analytical results to leaders, ensure the data is easily understood by both technical and non-technical audiences. It’s essential for this analyst to identify ways to improve status quo and clearly articulate findings in order to support product decisions and recommendations. They partner with cross functional teams to implement appropriate data management practices to ensure a data quality and maintain data privacy standards. We challenge our Analysts to identify opportunities for developing new insights, and provide technical leadership around operationalizing those insights, using both external best practices and internal knowledge. They are champions of data-driven decision-making, and we expect them to coach and mentor others on best practices.

Title: Senior Cybersecurity Data Analyst - Identity and Access Management
Qualifications:
At least 7 years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, management information systems
4 or more years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server family of products (SSMS, SSIS, SSRS) with extensive development experience using the MS T-SQL Query Language
2 or more years of experience with Tableau or a similar visual analysis technology
2 or more years of experience in design and application of advanced data analytic techniques
Requirement: This position does not require the incumbent to travel for work.
FullDescriptions:
Job Description

In this role, you will develop, deploy and maintain software solutions using Microsoft SQL Server products (SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS), Tableau and other technologies (such as Robotic Process Automation tools) to deliver solutions which improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the IAM Internal Controls function. We primarily operate in a Windows Server and desktop development environment although other hosting environments may be utilized in specific projects. You'll be responsible for maintaining analytics environments in conformance with Visa Corporate Key Controls, Technical Security Requirements and Privacy policies. You possess strong project management skills while performing end-to-end automation of data analytics routines and procedures in support of key initiatives such as Continuous Control Monitoring/Auditing, and will be expected to participate in all phases of development cycle (planning, design, development, testing, deployment and maintenance). Frequent engagement/interactions with internal teams to define the business and technical requirements will occur to prototype, develop and test advanced data analytics techniques. You will need to train users, document analytic procedures, and report progress to management.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
At least 7 years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, management information systems
4 or more years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server family of products (SSMS, SSIS, SSRS) with extensive development experience using the MS T-SQL Query Language
2 or more years of experience with Tableau or a similar visual analysis technology
2 or more years of experience in design and application of advanced data analytic techniques
Preferred Qualifications
Certificate in Data Science
MCSA and MCSE certification in SQL Server
Tableau Desktop Certification
Oracle database and PL/SQL development experience
Big Data and Machine learning experience
Masters degree in computer science or management information systems
Essential Functions
Planning, development and execution of Microsoft SQL server, SSIS, SSRS and Tableau based data analysis procedures to create sustainable and repeatable data analytics.
Follow Visa corporate development, deployment and change control methodologies.
Incorporate previous MS SQL Server-based data warehouse experience including ETL best practices in project design and development.
Monitor the refresh activities of the data warehouse including periodic data refresh, troubleshooting errors, fixing bugs and implementing enhancements.
Apply professional skepticism when assessing data sources and validate completeness and accuracy of data received.
Assist in the documentation of functional, technical and source data requirements.
Act as project leader for automation and audit support projects. Regularly inform manager of project status, issues, risks and results.
Interact with management and business partners to identify appropriate data elements required for analytics.
Provide support on the existing data analytics environment.
Demonstrate strong time and project management skills.
Demonstrate knowledge of the data analysis process and experience with the application of data analytics in the assessment of IT and business processes.
Consult with audit teams and provide data analysis support and guidance during audit engagement planning and execution.
Support data requests from the various audits. Activities may include extracting and downloading data, organizing that data, data scrubbing and performing analyses including thorough documentation of the steps performed.
Work with internal team members to meet department goals of zero audit findings with material weaknesses.
Possess strong written and oral communication skills and demonstrate these skills during the development process.
Additional Information

Work Hours
The incumbent must make themselves available during core business hours including routine evening global meetings
Travel Requirements
This position does not require the incumbent to travel for work.
Physical Requirements
This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, reach with hands and arms, and bend or lift up to 25 pounds.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Bioinformatician/Research Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Situated in Stanford’s highly dynamic research environment the Curtis Laboratory (http://med.stanford.edu/curtislab.html), led by Christina Curtis, PhD, is seeking a bioinformatician/Research Data Analyst 3 to join the Cancer Computational and Systems Biology group. The Curtis Laboratory is administratively situated within the Stanford Cancer Institute and is integrated within Stanford University and the School of Medicine’s Departments of Medicine (Oncology) and Genetics. Our research couples state-of-the-art computational and experimental techniques to characterize the evolutionary dynamics of tumor progression, to delineate the genotype-phenotype map in cancer and to define novel therapeutic targets and biomarkers.

The successful candidate will be part of an interdisciplinary research team developing novel technological and methodological approaches to improve the diagnosis, treatment and earlier detection of cancer. He/she will apply and develop bioinformatics and statistical methods to analyze and interpret high-throughput ‘omic’ data, including whole genome/exome sequencing, RNA-seq, ATAC-seq, single cell, and circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) data from patient samples and human organoids. A unifying theme of our research is to exploit ‘omic’ data derived from clinically annotated samples in robust computational frameworks coupled with iterative experimental validation in order to advance a systematic understanding of tumor progression. The candidate will contribute to extending our established tumor evolutionary dynamic framework and developing methods to understand adaptation during somatic evolution. The successful candidate will interact closely with other computational scientists, population geneticists, experimental biologists and clinicians to test, validate, and refine hypotheses. This is a fantastic opportunity for a motivated bioinformatician, computational genomicist to join a dynamic team with significant opportunities for scholarship and leadership.
Duties include:
Lead and own organization-wide data initiatives (e.g. models, frameworks, platforms, dashboards).
Supervise, coach and mentor a high-performing team of analysts.
Identify, leverage and partner with external firms.
Prioritize and extract data from a variety of sources such as notes, survey results, medical reports, and laboratory data, and maintain its accuracy and completeness.
Determine additional data collection and reporting requirements. Design and customize reports based upon data in the database. Oversee and monitor regulatory compliance for utilization of the data.
Use system reports and analyses to identify potentially problematic data, make corrections, and eliminate root cause for data problems or justify solutions to be implemented by others.
Create complex charts and databases, perform statistical analyses, and develop graphs and tables for publication and presentation.
Serve as a resource for non-routine inquiries such as requests for statistics or surveys.
Test prototype software and participate in approval and release process for new software.
Provide documentation based on audit and reporting criteria to investigators and research staff.
Work directly with the experimental lab members to analyze biomedical data and address scientific problems with bioinformatics techniques and tools and train researchers in the use of computational and bioinformatics tools.
Design, develop, and operate computational pipelines for the analysis of next-generation sequencing data
Analyze data sets to discover and annotate mutations in tumor specimens and laboratory models
Evaluate performance of novel technology platforms and assays.
Develop, refine, and improve bioinformatics tools for interpretation of large genomic data sets.
Evaluate and test third party software packages.
Manage and archive large data sets from next-generation sequencing experiments.
Install and maintain software and data.
Maintain detailed records of all analyses.
Present results and progress updates at lab meetings and make presentations to experimental and scientific collaborators.
Attend seminars, lectures, and training courses to learn new computational biology skills to remain up to date with the cancer genomics field and learn new programming languages or techniques as necessary.

* - Other duties may also be assigned


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Expertise in bioinformatics, computational genomics, evolutionary biology, accompanied by a relevant publication record.
Proficiency with high performance computing and multiple programming languages (C, Python, R).
Experience with high-throughput genome sequence data (WES, WGS, RNA-seq, ATAC-seq)
A background in evolutionary biology and familiarity with phylogenetics techniques.
Experience with high-performance computing, database management.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE (REQUIRED):
Bachelor's degree and five years or more of relevant experience or combination of education and relevant experience. Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics or engineering.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (REQUIRED):
Ability to direct the work of others, for jobs requiring supervision.
Relevant subject matter knowledge.
Substantial experience with MS Office and analytical programs.
Excellent writing and analytical skills.
Ability to prioritize workload.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:
Sitting in place at computer for long periods of time with extensive keyboarding/dexterity.
Occasionally use a telephone.
Rarely writing by hand.

- Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
Some work may be performed in a laboratory or field setting.

WORK STANDARDS:
Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.
Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.
Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.

Title: Healthcare Data Analyst, Clinical
FullDescriptions:
Cardinal Analytx is an early stage company at the intersection of AI and Care Delivery with Series B investors including John Doerr, Cardinal Partners, Premera Blue Cross, and Blue Shield California. Its founders are Stanford Professors and industry thought leaders Dr. Nigam Shah and Dr. Arnie Milstein. Cardinal Analytx is based in downtown Palo Alto with a growing team of data scientists, business leaders, engineers, and clinicians.
Cardinal Analytx applies the power of machine learning based on fresh discoveries at Stanford to better predict and responsibly contain health care spending for patients, health insurers, and health care delivery systems. Real time machine learning can not only predict imminent cost blooms, it can also predict the most cost-effective interventions. By combining advanced machine learning with leading edge clinical interventions, Cardinal Analytx enables timely and effective action for better clinical outcomes and significant cost savings.
As a Clinical Data Analyst, you will leverage your experience working with healthcare data to serve a cross-functional role to provide valuable analytic support to the clinical, data science and product teams. You will collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop claims-data based analytic insights that will help direct internal product strategy. The role will require a strong, hands-on individual, who is comfortable producing analyses for different stakeholders.
As a Clinical Data Analyst, You Will:
Develop, validate, and implement claims-data-based definitions under guidance of an interdisciplinary team
Work with interdisciplinary teams to generate scalable analyses (and accompanying quality control analytics) to inform and validate product and data science modeling assumptions
Work with internal data stakeholders to identify, evaluate, and implement new code sets to drive creation of clinically- and data-science-relevant features
Conduct research on vendor-based and publicly available drug, disease, and procedure classification methods
Work with clinical team to develop, validate, and implement clinical condition hierarchies

Desired Experience:
1-3 years experience of working with health claims data, encounter data, or discharge data
Demonstrable intermediate healthcare data domain knowledge (i.e. experience working with ICD codes, CPT codes, etc.)
Intermediate SQL programming experience
1-3 years experience in R or similar programming language
1-3 years experience in Excel/PowerPoint/Tableau
B.S./B.A. in analytic (e.g. economics, statistics, computer science) or healthcare-related field
Strong cross-functional communication and teamwork skills
Nice to Have, But Not Required:
Healthcare consulting experience
Knowledge of and/or experience working with medical terminology
Programming experience in analytic language (e.g. SAS, Stata, SPSS)
Location: Role is based in Palo Alto, CA.

*No recruiter submissions without prior agreement/consent*

Title: Analytics Program Manager, Real Estate and Workplace Services
Responsibilities:
Inspire and influence the organization to move from descriptive analysis to decision-making support, and grow the Analytics team to scale.
Understand the business context and client needs, and Real Estate and Workplace landscape, from strategic real estate planning and supply/demand portfolio management to employee needs around commuting and eating.
Drive the collaboration of many technical partners towards a shared broader roadmap; Establish cross-functional relationships with client groups owning various elements of workplace operations and leadership to build long-term product usefulness and adoption.
Influence evolution of analytics/BI infrastructure to drive the long-term development of REWS’ data infrastructure. Communicate through data visualization and analytics to simplify business problems.
Work partners to support them with data driven narratives to communicate with leaders about workplace decisions.
FullDescriptions:
Minimum qualifications:

6 years of experience in an analytical role defining strategy or making recommendations based on data analyses and communicating solutions to clients/audiences.
Experience with SQL, writing database queries, and working with datasets.
Experience managing products or programs, taking a team, tool, or idea from initial scoping to delivery and adoption.


Preferred qualifications:

MBA, or Master's degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Physics, Industrial Engineering, etc.).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, GIS), statistical software (e.g., R, Python), code repositories (e.g., Git, SVN, etc), and code review processes.
Experience in consulting, finance, technology, operations research/supply chain management or domain leveraging analytical practices.
Experience with changes to strategy, process, or systems and tools needed to enable data-driven decision making.
Experience translating business questions into analyses, and results into actionable recommendations.
Interpersonal skills, experience teaching data literacy, ability to influence stakeholders and leverage interpersonal relationships.
About the job
Our team seeks to gain insights from data to help make better workplace decisions. As the Analytics Program Manager, you will be part Data Analyst and one part Program Manager - adding value today by analyzing what data we do have and guiding technology and infrastructure projects that will help us answer the big questions of tomorrow.
The Real Estate and Workplace Services (REWS) team creates inspiring spaces and innovative services that bring Google’s culture and values to life. We build and maintain all aspects of what keeps our Googley workspaces operating seamlessly across multiple cities and regions globally. We also manage the industry-leading services that help make Google a great place to work - from how we design healthy and collaborative workspaces, create energizing food experiences, provide convenient transportation and fitness options, to delivering inclusive environments where Google and our employees can thrive.
Responsibilities
Inspire and influence the organization to move from descriptive analysis to decision-making support, and grow the Analytics team to scale.

Influence evolution of analytics/BI infrastructure to drive the long-term development of REWS’ data infrastructure. Communicate through data visualization and analytics to simplify business problems.
Work partners to support them with data driven narratives to communicate with leaders about workplace decisions.

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Are you a driven and inquisitive data scientist? Do you love finding insights in large, unique datasets? Want to play a crucial role at a dynamic company?
Join Arosys as a Data Scientist! As part of this fast-growing team, you’ll develop deep insights for our business units to execute as we continue to grow, and have a tremendous impact on the success of a game-changing company.
What you’ll do:
Extract actionable insights from huge volumes of data using data mining, statistics, and database techniques.
Work cross-functionally to identify problems in different areas where data mining/machine learning/statistics can help.
Conduct studies, rapid pilots, and use advanced data mining and modelling techniques to build solutions that optimise the quality and performance of our data.
Analyse data quality issues and identify root causes and remedies.
Simplify and explain data science work examples to non-quant business users.
What’s required:
Fluency in modern advanced analytical tools and programming languages (e.g. Python, R, MATLAB etc.).
A PhD in statistics, math, engineering, physical sciences, computer science or another quantitative discipline.
Substantial experience with the use of relational (and un-relational) databases for data storage and analysis, including SQL fluency for data extraction and management.
Curiosity and pragmatism! You should be excited to ask the right questions, find the right answers, and identify trends and factors important for the business.
Experience with machine learning, conceptual modelling, hypothesis testing, NLP, etc. is a plus.

Title: Misinformation Data Analyst, Community Operations
FullDescriptions:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Community Operations' focus is on improving the health of our products and helping people understand how to use them through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people's issues, and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We need influencers who can align cross-functional partners to ensure the best possible experience for our platforms. If you like helping people, Community Operations is for you.

The Misinformation Data Analysts help protect the integrity of Facebook News Feed by leveraging their strong data skills to analyze content, investigate trends that might violate Facebook policies, and build data based case for action. You will work alongside Product Managers, UX Researchers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Engineers to proactively identify and independently lead strategic projects geared towards reducing the spread of low-quality content, including misinformation, sensationalism, engagement bait and clickbait among others. You will also work to improve the civility of content in feed. Successful candidates for this role have strong data analytics and statistics skills, are efficient critical thinkers and problem-solvers, are able to navigate ambiguity, and are always looking for strategic opportunities to improve how systems and processes work.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Engage in discussions to identify problems, quantify and improve the quality of workflows, and lead projects to execution
Cultivate relationships and collaborate with cross-functional partners to shape, support, and execute product goals
Conduct forensic deep dives into integrity abuse to inform product direction
Work with Integrity Operations Project Managers to operationalize metrics and team goals to measure Facebook's effectiveness at combating integrity issues
Identify and share insights and learnings to develop scalable solutions
Manage multiple different work flows and projects
The Misinformation Data Analyst role will work across the following areas:
Completing forensic data analysis
Building data pipelines and dashboards
Operationalizing metrics
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
BA or BS degree
1+ years experience doing quantitative analysis
1+ years experience in SQL or Python, R, C++
1+ years of industry experience in consumer-oriented product environment, consulting, analytics, or operations role
Knowledge in statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions)
Experience communicating the results of analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or other technical fields
Experience operationalizing measurements and applying statistical analysis to evaluate process performance
Ability to assess, analyze and resolve complicated issues, and distill that complexity into simple and concise concepts
Experience juggling multiple priorities in a dynamic and changing environment
Experience working with remote cross-functional teams
Threat intelligence, abuse detection and investigation experience
Fluency in other languages

Title: Data Analyst 3 (CA)
FullDescriptions:
Job Title: UX Researcher, NX, NASBO

Samsung Visual Display NX team (Next Experience) at SEA (Samsung Electronics America) is a new product team that designs and implements user experience for high-profile, consumer electronics product lines, from core Samsung TV shipping products like Q Series and the Frame TV, to the future of Business, Home & Lifestyles family of digital appliances and services. The products and services we design offer users benefits that are only made possible through tightly integrated technologies at a global scale worldwide.

As a UX Researcher, you will work with the research lead in a cross-disciplinary team to support research work for innovative consumer products.

Job Description:
Test the accuracy and completeness of TV Plus (and other apps / device) log data
o Work with the research lead to identify the key scenarios for TV Plus (and other apps / devices)
o Perform key scenarios on a known TV while documenting and video recording each scenario to create an accurate verifiable time-stamped record
o Work with research lead to acquire the log data for the known TV during the time period of the performed scenarios
o Compare the recorded scenarios with the log data and note discrepancies
o Put together a detailed report describing discrepancies between scenarios and log data together with an analysis and summary of problems and recommendations
o Work with research lead to report to the appropriate team(s)
Assist lead researcher with research projects including usability studies, surveys, in-home visits, etc.

Required qualifications
Master’s degree or equivalent training in an accredited college or university in Experimental, Applied, or Cognitive Psychology; Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction, Ergonomics or a related field1 + years of experience (including in-school experience) conducting research on consumer productsAble to plan, conduct, moderate, analyze and present results of empirical research studies with human participants
Desired qualifications
Experience analyzing and summarizing log data from people’s use of devices and systems

1) Top 3 Must Have Skills:

a. Proficiency in analyzing large-scale customer event-based consumer product usage data (e.g., from TVs, voice assistants, digital appliances, web sites)
b. Proficiency in at least one major programming language (e.g., Python)
c. Experience with advanced methods for exploring consumer behaviors and characteristics (Multidimensional Scaling, Factor Analysis, Regression Analysis, Machine Learning, etc.)

2) Top Three Good To Have Skills:
a. Masters or Doctorate degree in Experimental or Cognitive Psychology, Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science or a related field
b. 2+ years of industry experience conducting quantitative user experience research
c. Experience in TV/video, audio entertainment, social applications, and/or other home consumer electronics

Title: Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
About Study.com
We are a technology company on a mission to make education accessible. Study.com helps millions of students improve their grades, gain career skills and earn college credit. We offer self-paced, online video courses that cover every subject taught in middle school through junior college as well as a growing suite of corporate learning and professional education products. We've built our platform from the ground up, leveraging data and technology to make the entire learning process simple and engaging for students.
We are a profitable, fast growing company looking to expand our team.
We began our journey in 2002 as a self-funded start-up and have grown every year since our inception. As a small, independent company, our employees have a direct impact on company direction and results.
We are located in the heart of downtown Mountain View, just a few steps from the Caltrain station. We only hire top talent, so those who pass our rigorous interview process will find themselves as part of one of the brightest and most innovative teams in Silicon Valley.
Study.com was also top ranked in Inc. Best Place to Work!
We have a culture of social responsibility. As we continue to generate profits, we give back by funding scholarship programs and helping charitable organizations provide open access to information and education throughout the poorest regions of the world.
Come join us on our mission and make a difference.
About the Data Analyst Position
As a technology leader, we have high-traffic websites and store massive amounts of data that we need to slice and dice every day. We are looking for a Data Analyst that will be part of a growing, world-class team supporting our account management and site optimization groups. The ideal candidate for the Data Analyst role will be a key resource for analytic best practices within Study.com and for analyzing and querying data in a fast-paced Internet business environment.
The Data Analyst must be passionate about digging into data and understanding the stories the data are telling. You will be equally passionate about helping others solve problems, gain insights, and make decisions using data.
Responsibilities:
As part of the Business Intelligence team, own and maintain the entire data warehouse, including tens of millions of events coming through a Kafka queue each day, a 15 TB relational data warehouse, and integration with Google BigQuery.
Work in a cross-functional team and be the team's point person for any data related tasks (ETLing, analysis, visualizations, etc.)
Monitor and analyze the team's A/B tests and proactively communicate key insights within your team and to external stakeholders.
Be the voice of data by supporting the team's product owner in making data driven decisions and defining KPIs.
Actively establish processes and build tools to make data more accessible to everyone.
Use your knowledge of statistics to support the Business Intelligence team in building and maintaining machine learning models (logistic regressions, recurrent neural nets, etc.) that drive a significant portion of our revenue.
Help and teach others throughout the company to better use and understand our data.
Requirements:
A passion for learning and a willingness to pick up whatever you need to to get the job done
4+ years' experience in a data analyst role, experience with web analytics is a plus
Solid MySQL/SQL experience or other related databases
Solid experience in Excel for data analysis and visualization
Strong analytical skills and ability to draw conclusions based on data
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while juggling multiple projects
BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, or similar fields
Good interpersonal communication and presentation skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented and passionate
Preferred Qualifications:
Reporting and Business Intelligence experience (Tableau, QlikView, Microstrategy, etc)
Proficient in using statistical software (R, MATLAB, SAS, etc.)
Hands-on experience with advanced statistical concepts, such as cluster analysis, singular value decomposition, stochastic gradient descent, and Bayesian methods
Experience using an ETL tool (Pentaho, Talend, SSIS, etc.) on large datasets (terabytes in size)
Knowledge of web analytics software and best practices
Knowledge of some programming knowledge in a scripting language such as Groovy, Python, Perl, or in a compiled language such as Java or C++
Higher degrees such as Masters or PhD
Why work for Study.com?
Help make education accessible to people who need it
Enjoy a fun, casual and collaborative working environment
Join a profitable and financially stable company
Help impact company decisions and direction
See results of your work in days, not years
Have your work impact 30+ million web visitors each month
Work with other talented and passionate team members
Benefits:
Competitive compensation
401(k) retirement plan with employer matching
20 days of flexible paid time off annually (increases to 30 days over 5 years)
Additional 10 paid holidays annually
Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans
Fully subsidized Caltrain pass
Tuition reimbursement and gift matching programs
Stocked kitchen and beverages provided
Company sponsored gym memberships
Company sponsored happy hours to celebrate accomplishments
Study.com provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran or disability status. In addition to federal law requirements, Study.com complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. Additionally, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with applicable state and local laws.

Title: Data Analyst, Search Analytics
Responsibilities:
Perform sophisticated data analysis to uncover key insights about Search and its ecosystem.
Use analytical insights to solve important business problems and formulate robust, actionable recommendations for leadership.
Utilize excellent communication skills to clearly distill the essence of your technical work to audiences of all levels and across multiple functional areas.
Navigate complex situations and influence across multiple product areas by leveraging leadership acumen.
Develop a deep understanding of how Product and feature launches impact user behavior and the business implications of such changes and contribute to the development of analytical frameworks, tools, and skills.

About the job
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Data Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. Working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to take on big picture challenges.

As someone who knows the workings of the core Finance team inside and out, you'll lead individual projects to transform planning, tracking and control processes. You'll provide senior level management with insightful recommendations, planning and reporting support.

The Search Analytics team provides strategic analysis of Google’s Search business to executive audiences. As part of this team, you will have a unique birds-eye perspective on Google’s core business, the ecosystem players that partner with Search, and how Finance supports Search's mission to create excellent products for its users. Our work provides an exciting opportunity to propel the Search business forward while solving complex and important business problems for the company. You will be an integral part of a working group that collaborate on key Product initiatives, and you will play an instrumental role in analyzing the strategies and success of such high-profile product, feature, and user initiatives.
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

Navigate complex situations and influence across multiple product areas by leveraging leadership acumen.

Title: Data Analyst/Software Engineer - NFAC - NLR-01100-2
Qualifications:
B.S. degree in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering (or a closely related discipline) plus 1 to 3 years of relevant engineering experience in data acquisition and analysis.
Experience with code development and data visualization.
Comfortable in a highly dynamic working environment managing several different projects simultaneously.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
General knowledge of test and evaluation.
Willingness to learn and expand technical understanding of wind tunnel test techniques and measurement systems.
FullDescriptions:
Job title: Data Analyst/Software Engineer -
Grade: 33/34

An exciting career opportunity exists for an Data Analyst/Software Engineer supporting a team of engineers and technicians who maintain and operate the largest wind tunnel in the world.

This opportunity is being offered by National Aerospace Solutions, LLC, the team selected by the U.S. Air Force to conduct Test Operations and Sustainment at the Arnold Engineering Development Complex (AEDC), National Full-scale Aerodynamics Complex (NFAC) at Moffett Field, CA. The NFAC provides the United States with the capability of performing ground-based aerodynamic and acoustic experiments at speeds from static to nearly 350 mph on large-scale and full-scale aerospace vehicles and components. This complex includes a 40- by 80-foot wind tunnel and an 80- by 120-foot wind tunnel.

AEDC’s mission is to conduct developmental test and evaluation for the Nation through modeling, simulation, ground test and flight test. Execution of the mission requires a large team of highly qualified and dedicated professionals from multiple technical disciplines to effectively accomplish the objectives of our test customers.

Job Summary:
This is an engineering role comprised of wind tunnel data acquisition system preparation and data analysis in a cross-functional, multi-disciplined team working closely with test customers, test directors, instrumentation engineers, and data system technicians.

Job Duties:
Interface with test customers and test directors to establish requirements for the data system and data analysis tasks.
Setup the data system and develop software programs to meet test data acquisition requirements. Prepare associated documentation and procedures.
Guide the preparation and checkout of the test instrumentation through the data acquisition system and perform validation of the test measurements.
Perform data analysis, including associated code development, to ensure data quality.
Validate test data against test objectives and prepare data analysis reports.
Evaluate opportunities for data acquisition capability upgrades and support strategic asset planning to maintain or improve current capabilities.
Perform other related duties as required, including, but not limited to, instrumentation and data systems configuration design and planning, and test article performance and stability predictions.
It is a condition of employment to wear company issued PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) in accordance with supervisory direction and company policy.
Perform other related duties as required.


Basic Qualifications:
B.S. degree in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering (or a closely related discipline) plus 1 to 3 years of relevant engineering experience in data acquisition and analysis.
Experience with code development and data visualization.
Comfortable in a highly dynamic working environment managing several different projects simultaneously.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
General knowledge of test and evaluation.
Willingness to learn and expand technical understanding of wind tunnel test techniques and measurement systems.


Preferred Qualifications:
MS degree in engineering or data analysis.
Familiarity with wind tunnel test techniques and measurement systems.


Due to Air Force Security requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required for employment at NFAC.

NAS is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minority/Women/Veterans/Disabled (AA/EOE). All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, citizenship, genetic information, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. Applicants with a physical or mental disability, who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, may e-mail their request to careers@nas-llc.us.

Title: Sr. Manager/ Principal Data Analyst - Risk
FullDescriptions:
About Earnin:
Every year, while Americans wait for their paychecks, more than $1 trillion of their hard-earned money is held up in the pay cycle. As a result, we accumulate over $50 billion in late and overdraft fees and turn to high-interest loans. Overdraft charges and bank fees often trap people in a cycle of debt that can lead to unhealthy decisions and falling victim to predatory businesses disguised as helpful services. We don't accept that.

Earnin is an app that creates products that help people gain control of their finances. Cash Out lets people get paid as soon as they leave work, with no fees, interest, or hidden costs. With Health Aid, Earnin negotiates on behalf of community members to lower their total unpaid medical bill and work out a budget-friendly payment plan. Cash Back Rewards is a way for members to earn up to 10% cash back on purchases from over a thousand local and national businesses without needing a credit card or having to reach spend thresholds to earn cash rewards — and they can withdraw the money at any time. We also offer free tools to help avoid overdrafts, to remind people when recurring bills are due, and we're working on more! There is never any required cost to use any of these products or services, users can choose to tip what they think is fair to support the service and pay it forward to keep the movement going.

Earnin is supported by funding partners including Andreessen Horowitz, Matrix Partners, Ribbit Capital, Felicis Venture, Thrive Capital, and others. Join us and help build a new financial system focused on fairness and people's needs.

You can help make a difference.

About the Team:
Business decisions at Earnin rely heavily on good analysis. Autonomous, cross-functional product and operational teams (we call them "pods") drive these decisions on a day to day basis. You'll help a group of pods make product decisions by providing them with insights from our data. For success in this role, you'll need to be comfortable diving deep into the data, owning your analysis, and communicating your insights in an accessible way.

The Risk Pod sits at the heart of Earnin. As the owners of the core business metrics, Risk powers the financial engine that allows Earnin to constantly deliver value to our community. Our Risk team has taken a unique approach to risk management, portfolio management, and interacting with our community members.

This position will give you ample opportunity to use and enhance your analytics skills and be hands-on with a complex product in an interesting market. We're in the process of building out our analytics capabilities, so you'll also have a chance to shape the methods and tools that we use. Our business has interesting characteristics for analysis, e.g. lack of a fixed price or term, heavy dependency on external events and providers, and a very data-rich environment. It also has a large and direct impact on the financial lives of its users.

This role has the potential for massive impact on Earnin's growth trajectory. If you have a passion for helping people and a background in data, we want to hear from you!

What Set Us Apart:

A mission to improve the financial lives of folks who need help
Exceptional product-market fit with NPS scores in the 80s
$185 million raised from top tier fintech investors
Great growth, unit economics and user acquisition costs

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Integrated decision making in the business area considering broader economic P&L, brand and people impact
Ownership mindset managing portfolio with P&L accountability in the business segment
Drive step-change improvements in risk management performance by connecting drivers of future consumer needs to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis
May manage and develop a team of analysts. Coaching and mentoring analysts to develop and retain talent
Ability to execute decisions in an uncertain and fluid environment
Provide colleagues with guidance in making product, marketing and operations decisions from an analytical perspective.
Lead business monitoring to have close visibility on key metrics
Work closely with data science team to improve risk models with business insights and past experience

Some skills we consider critical to being a Principal Data Analyst:


4+ years of quantitative analysis using data manipulation tools like SQL, R, Python
Ability to communicate statistical analysis and business analysis in well balanced way
Proven project experience where cross functional teams are involved
Expertise with data manipulation. An ideal candidate is comfortable joining/merging data sets with complex relationships and identifying and troubleshooting data issues. SQL, R, Python with pandas experience preferred, but extensive experience using SAS, Excel, etc is also possible.
Can identify and effectively prioritize opportunities to make our business better with analysis.
Experience with delivering information that solves product, marketing or operations questions.
Communicates metrics and data clearly and able to translate analytical insights to business metrics
Ability to apply statistics and probability concepts to split testing or LTV estimation
Works well in a time and resource constrained environment. Can prioritize, get things done on their own, but ask for help when needed.

In addition, we expect you to have or quickly develop:

Significant experience with R, python, git, schema creation
Data visualization with any of the following tools: Looker, Tableau, R/Python packages, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.
Experience with 3rd party analytics services like Google Analytics, Amplitude, Braze
BS or Master's Degree, and relevant experience
Have 4+ years of relevant experience, preferably within a high-growth environment.
